titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas Manuscripts
Wagner (Henry Raup) Collection of Texas Manuscripts
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 07:21
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas manuscripts

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Letters, including several from or pertaining to Stephen F. Austin, official correspondence and documents, degrees, expedientes and reports,recording the history and development of Mexico's northeastern frontier from 1707-1847. Most of the collection concerns Texas, but there are also important documents concerning Louisiana and New Mexico.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas Manuscripts is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas Manuscripts. Yale Collection of Western Americana. Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Other portions of Wagner's Texas manuscripts have been cataloged separately. They include the Wagner Collection of Texas and Coahuila Land Grants and papers of Jean Louis Berlandier and of Philip Nolan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas Manuscripts contains letters, including several from or pertaining to Stephen F. Austin, official correspondence and documents, decrees, "expedientes" and reports, recording the history and development of Mexico's northeastern frontier from 1707-1847. Most concern Texas, but the collection also includes documents concerning Louisiana, New Mexico, the Provincias Internas and the Estados Internos de Oriente. Researchers should note that spelling variations as found on the original documents are maintained in the finding aid, so "jefe" may appear as "gefe", "Bexar" as "Bejar", etc. When searching for specific terms, this should be taken into account. The original documents are accompanied by a series of typed translations, prepared by John V. Clay and Alan Probert, of the letters and documents concerning Juan Davis Bradburn.

did.unittitle: Original Documents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The original documents are arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Mexico. (Viceroyalty) Viceroy, 1702- 1709 (Albuquerque)
LS to Pedro de Aguirre, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 22 cm. Aguirre was captain of the Compania Volante del Rio de Norte.

did.unittitle: Coahuila, Mexico. Governor, 1709 (Padilla)
Copy of proceedings of Gov. Padilla on royal cedula requiring seizure of property of Portuguese nationals.
Mexico. (Viceroyalty) Viceroy, 1716- 1722 (Zuniga)
Despatch ordering military escort for two missionaries going to Texas, Mexico.
Spain. Laws, statutes, etc.
Copia de la real cedula sobre oficios vendibles y renunciables.
Mexico. (Viceroyalty) Viceroy, 1734- 1740, (Vizarron)
LS to Blas de la Garzo Falcon, Governor of Coahuila and de Ecoy y Musquiz, Capt. of Presidio de Rio Grande, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 20 p. 32 cm. Concerning orders for founding mission at Peyot and Presidio Sacramento de Rio Grande. With the letter are bound copies of the orders, official statements of their execution, diary of the expedition to the new presidio and a list of members of the expedi- tion.

did.unittitle: Mexico (Viceroyalty) Viceroy, 1755-1760 (Amarillas)
Decreto del Virrey Marques de las Amarillas para que el Coronel D. Diego Ortiz Parrilla establesca el presidio de S. Saba, Mexico.
Provincias Internas, Mexico. Comandante General, 1776-1783 (Croix)
LS to Governor of Coahuila, Chihuahua.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 30 cm. Orders Lt. Eugenio Fernandez to command the Presidio at Bahia del Espirito Santo.

did.unittitle: Ramirez, Pedro.
Expediente sobre que paguen diexmos las misiones de Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 8 p. 32 cm. A letter from Ramirez to Gen. Croix, with copy of letter to ecclesias- tical official of tithes.

did.unittitle: Coahuila, Mexico. Governor, 1777-1783 (Ugalde)
Proclamation forbidding export of livestock from the province because of acute shortage, Monclova.
Texas (Province) Gobernador, 1778-1787 (Cabello)
[Expediente] Sobre tratantes de la Luisiana para su comercio con los Indios Amigos de Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 108 p. 10-31.5 cm. At head of title: Provincia de Texas. Años de 1784 a 88. Correspondence between the governors of Texas and Louisiana and officials at Nacogdoches and Natchitoches relating to trade with Indians on the Texas border.

did.unittitle: Texas (Province) Gobernador, 1778-1787 (Cabello)
ALS to Jacobo Ugarte y Loyola, Comandante General of the Provincias Internas, Bexar, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 6 p. 30 cm. Encloses an account of expenses for presents to Indians.

did.unittitle: Guerra, Pedro
ALS to Miguel José de Emperan, Candela, Coahuila.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2, 4, 3 p. 30 cm. Transmitting lists of inhabitants of Candela, their weapons and horses.

did.unittitle: Nolasco Corrasco, Pedro
Relacion que manifiesta la posibilidad, Armas y Caballos que tienen los vecinos agregados a este Presidio de San Juan Baptista del Rio Grande. . ., Presidio de Rio Grande.
Barela Bermudez, Franciso
Report to Gov. Miguel José de Emperan on the arms and horses at Parras.
Mascaro, Manuel Agustin
ALS to Bernardo Bonavia, Zimapan, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. col.plan 29 cm. On a bridge to be built at Taxguillo. Includes TLS from Phil Townsend Hanna, "Westways", to H.R. Wagner, Nov 12, 1936, re. publication of the letter and plan in an upcoming issue of "Westways".

did.unittitle: Flores, Vicente, claimant
Expediente promovido por Dn. Vicente Flores sobre Posesion de rancho nombrado Nra. Sa. de los Dolores juez comisndo. el Gobr. de la Prova. de Texas teniente Coronel Dn. Manuel Muñoz.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 65 numb.l 32 cm.

did.unittitle: Barela Bermudez, Francisco
LS to Intendente of San Luis Potosi, Parras, Coahuila.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 5 p. 30 cm. Asks to be relieved as subdelegado. 2 other documents relating to the request appended.

did.unittitle: Spain. Sovereigns, etc., 1788-1808 (Charles IV)
Copy of royal cedula of Mar. 23, 1798, relating to land grants, promulgated at Monclova December, 1798.
Provincias Internas, Mexico. Comandante General, 1792-1804 (Nava).
Order rationing cigarros, Chihuahua.
Noticias, Estensas, y Geografia de Nuevo Mexico hechas el año de 1805.
Information compiled for the consulate at Vera Cruz.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 67 p. 31 cm. Contains (1) Account of New Mexico (2) Letter 16 Jul 1808 from José María Quiros to Nemesio Salcedo requesting further information (3) Salcedo's answer, dated 1 Sep 1808 (4) Account of Nueva Viscaya (5) Account of Texas by Gov. J.B. Elguezabal (6) Statistics of New Mexico, Coahuila, Texas, and Sonora.

did.unittitle: Mexico. (Viceroyalty) Laws, statutes, etc.
Copy of cedula relating to land grants in the Provincias Internas, Aranjuez.
Spain. Ministerio de Hacienda.
Copia de real orden pasada por el ministro de hacienda al intendente del Nuevo Orleans sobre las diferencias ocurridas con los Estados Unidos de America, Aranjuez.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 5 p. 32 cm. Outlines the claims made by Monroe and Pinckney including the boundaries of Louisiana, the breakdown of negotiations, and warns against American hostile action. Signed: Soler, and addressed to Sr. D. Ventura Morales.

did.unittitle: Expediente sobre ocurrencias de la frontera hasta la retirada a Natchitoches del Exercito Americana 1806.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 18 p. 30 cm. Copy made in 1827 of correspondence in 1806 between Gov. Cordero of Texas and Gen. Wilkinson on question of Texas-Louisiana boundary.

did.unittitle: Wilkinson, James, 1757-1825.
Translation of letter to Gov. Cordero of Texas, Nacogdoches, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 32 cm. On the Texas-Louisiana boundary question.

did.unittitle: Spain. Ministerio de Hacienda.
Copy of letter to Viceroy of Mexico, Madrid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 31 cm. Transmits information from Spanish consul at New York on smugglers.

did.unittitle: Fundacion de la Villa de Palafox,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 50 p. 21-30 cm. Contains original petition of Juan José Dias and official correspon- dence relating to the founding of Palafox, Apr 7, 1809 - Aug 21, 1810.

did.unittitle: Martinez, Augustin.
ALS to Gov. Cordero of Texas, Santa Rosa, Texas.
Provincias Internas, Mexico. Comandante General, 1805-1813 (Salcedo).
Declaration of amnesty to parti- cipants in the Hidalgo rebellion, Chihuahua.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 44 cm. With endorsements showing publi- cation at Monclova, Santa Rosa, Candela, and other points.

did.unittitle: Mexico. (Viceroyalty) Audencia Real.
Resolucion de la Real Audencia de Guadalajara sobre la Solicitud hecha por el gobernador de Tejas acerca de que se le concediere facultad para mandar dar azotes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 20 p. 15-32 cm. Petition of Gov. Salcedo July 9, 1810, decision of the Audencia Jan 16, 1812, of the royal cedula on which the decision was based, and letters of transmittal.

did.unittitle: Flores, Tomas

Don Tomas Flores, Administrador de Tabacos de Coaguila y Texas, repre- sentando que el Caudillo de los Insurgentes, Pedro Aranda, mando descontar en Riogrande ocho mil pesos que el Fiel de Tabaco de Bexar Suplio de los productos de la renta al Habilitado de aquella compana, solicita su reintegro.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 39 p. 21-32 cm. Flores' petition and accompanying documents.

did.unittitle: Ciudad de Bexar. Ano de 1813. Expediente instruido sobre el embargo, avaluo y remate de bienes a los individuos de la misma ciudad que tomaron partido con los insurgentes por una junta formada de orden superior compuesta del Capitan Francisco del Prado, Luis Galan, José Antonio Saucedo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 124 p. 32 cm. Confiscation of property of those who took part in Hidalgo's revolt against Spain.

did.unittitle: Ramos Arizpe, Miguel, 1775-1843.
Translation of an address presented to the Cortes of Spain in the year 1813 by Doctor Don Miguel Arispe...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 52 p. 24.5 cm. Incomplete. A description of the Provincias Internas. Pub. Cadiz 1812 with title: Memoria que el Doctor D. Miguel Ramos de Ariste .... presenta a el Augusto Congreso ... Cf. Streeter, Bib . of Texas, no 1050.

did.unittitle: Noticia de la revolucion de la Provincia de Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 12 p. 32 cm. A compilation of official docu- ments, with a short introduction, relating to the Gutierrez-Magee expedition.

did.unittitle: Garza, Ramon de la
LS to Comandante General, Provincias internas, Rio Grande.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports the abandonment of the Villa of Palafox.

did.unittitle: ALS to Comandante General, Provincias internas, Presidio de Rio Grande.
Nava, José María
Declaracion tomada al Vecino de Bexar José María Nava que se presente de este punto fugado de la Nacion Comanche, Presidio de Bahia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by letter of trans- mittal to Governor of Texas and by him to Comandante, Provincias internas.

did.unittitle: Spain. Sovereigns, etc., 1814-1833. (Ferdinand VII).
Copy of Royal order including Englishmen in the amnesty granted to rebels in the Spanish colonies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 21 cm. Transmitted by Joaquin Arredondo, Comandante General of the Provincias Internas to the Governor of Coahuila, Jan 3, 1821.

did.unittitle: Provincias Internas de Oriente, Mexico. Comandante General, 1821-1823 (Lopez)
LS to Governor of Coahuila, Saltillo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 21 cm. Transmits copy of Act of Independence of Mexico.

did.unittitle: Medero, José Francisco.
LS to Governor Elozua of Coahuila, Monclova.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 21 cm. On local political affairs.

did.unittitle: Cuatro Cienegas, Mexico. Ayuntamiento.
ALS to Antonio Crespo, Cuatro Cienegas.
Seguin, Erasmo, 1782-1857.
Memoria que Don Erasmo Seguin Dipu- tado permanente de la Provincia de Texas, presentio al exmo. sor. Presidente de la Republica Mexicana.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 13 p. 31 cm. Last leaf torn, interferes with signature. Refers to conditions in the province of Texas and recommends that measures of precaution be taken to safeguard the province.

did.unittitle: Nuevo Leon, Mexico. Congreso.
LS to the Deputies of Coahuila and Texas, Monterrey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 29 cm. Signed: Juan José de la Garza and Joséph Francisco Arroyos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 25 cm. Concerned with permission for the inhabitants to export some of their products.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 20 cm. Signed: Alaman. Concerned with immigration restrictions in relation to Great Britain and the U.S.

did.unittitle: Austin, Stephen Fuller, 1793-1836.
LS to Rafael Gonzales, San Felipe de Austin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 25 cm. "Duplicado" at head of page 1.

did.unittitle: Coahuila and Texas (State) Gobernador, 1824-1826 (Gonzales).
AL to Esteban Austin, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 21 cm. Signed with rubric. Discusses the necessity for Political Chief of the Department who resides at Bexar to be given enough money.

did.unittitle: AL to Esteban Austin, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 22 cm. Signed with rubric.

DS to captains of ships bound for Mexico, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Mexico. Secretaría de Relaciones Exteriores.
ALS to the Governer of Coahuila and Texas, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 20.5 cm. Orders that Richard Raynal Keene not be allowed to enter the country. Signed: Alaman.

did.unittitle: LS to Governor of Coahuila and Texas, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 20.5 cm. At top: Reservado. On allowing U.S. citizens to settle in the prohibited frontier areas.

did.unittitle: ALS to the Governor of Coahuila and Texas, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 20 cm. Signed: Alaman

did.unittitle: Coahuila and Texas (State) Secretaría.
Letters, signed, to the Governor of the State of Coahuila and Texas, Saltillo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 items. 30 cm. Signed: El Baron de Bastrop y Maríano Varela. Relate to the new laws proposed by the Ayuntamiento. Accompanied by a list of expedientes (1 p.).

did.unittitle: Mexico. Comision de Limites.
Instruccion de D. Pedro Simon del Campo Secretario que fue de ambar comands de la de Oriente y Occidente.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 items. 21 cm. Inventories of armaments at Bejar, Bahia del Espiritu Santo and Parron, 1825 Oct 30, copied at Saltillo, 1825 Nov 14, with letter of transmittal 1825 Dec 6, signed by Mateo Ahumada.

did.unittitle: U.S. Legation. Spain.
Copy of a letter to the Duque del Infantado Principal Secretary of State, Madrid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 57 p. 32 cm. "Confidential" at head of page 1. Discusses Spain's recognition of Mexico's independence.

did.unittitle: Austin, Stephen Fuller, 1793-1836.
Report of strength and armament of the militia at San Felipe de Austin, San Felipe de Austin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1p. 21.5x33.5 cm. Signed: Estevan F. (Stephen Fuller) Austin.

did.unittitle: Sepulveda, José Antonio.
Report on the militia company at Nacogdoches, Texas, Nacogdoches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1p. 34 cm. Signed: José Antonio Sepulveda. Certified by Samuel Norris.

did.unittitle: Austin, Stephen Fuller, 1793-1836.
Copy of LS to José Antonio Saucedo, San Felipe de Austin, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 23 cm. Transmits a request for permission to organize a militia company at Nacogdoches.

did.unittitle: LS to Victor Blanco, San Felipe de Austin, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 23.5 cm A reponse to the accusations of James Gaines concerning Austin's interference in the formation of a militia.

did.unittitle: Copy of Report to the Congress of the State of Coahuila and Texas, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 7 p. 31 cm. "Es copia: J. Antonio Padilla" Ideas pertaining to the intro- duction of slaves into the new colonies.

did.unittitle: U.S. Dept. of State.
Draft of a report on the Panama Congress, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 25 cm. Signed: H. Clay

did.unittitle: Coahuila and Texas (State) Gobernador, 1827-1831 (Viesca).
Draft of LS to Stephen F. Austin, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 30 cm. Signed with rubric. The government is satisfied with Austin's conduct and good faith.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Ayuntamiento.
LS to Comandante General, Coahuila and Texas, San Fernando de Bexar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 33 cm. and enclosures 13 p. 20-33 cm. Protests closing of San Bernardo Bay as a port of entry, and encloses copies of previous orders and correspondence on the subject.

did.unittitle: Austin, Stephen Fuller, 1793-1836.
ALS to Governor of Coahuila and Texas, Saltillo, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 30 cm. On the system of government in Austin's colony.

did.unittitle: ALS to Governor of Coahuila and Texas, Saltillo, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 27.5 cm. On cost of sealed paper.

did.unittitle: Coahuila and Texas (State) Gobernador, 1827-1831 (Viesca).
Draft of a letter to Stephen F. Austin, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 30 cm. Signed with rubric.

did.unittitle: Bustamente, Anastasio, Pres. Mexico, 1780-1853.
ALS to Manuel Mier y Teran, Matamoros, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 30 cm. Signed with rubric. Encloses copy of pay roll for offi- cers of the boundary commission.

did.unittitle: Courier del Natchitoches de Julio 23 1828.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 5 p. 30 cm. Translations of excerpts from the Courier of June 16 and July 23, 1828, relating to Texas.

did.unittitle: Bradburn, Juan Davis.
LS to Manuel de Mier y Teran, Matamoros, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 32 cm. On p. 4 is a draft of a reply.

did.unittitle: Mexico (Republic). Secretaría de la Defensa Nacional.
Informe Sre. seis cartas de Tejas y en la particular de la Bahia de Galveston y la posicion de un fuerte en la isla, Soto la Marina.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 13 p. 30 cm. Title from docket. Copy of a letter to Felipe de la Garza on the subject of a fort at Galveston Bay. Enclosed: copy of reports from Juan Nunez and Alejandro Thompson of the Mexican Navy, and a copy of a letter from Felipe de la Garza to the Secretaría de Guerra y Marina. With letter of transmittal from Felipe de la Garza to Manuel de Mier y Teran.

did.unittitle: Monterrey, Mexico. Diputacion Permanente.
Proyeto de la diputacion permante. de Monterrey concernte. a la conservacion y mas facil defensa de Tejas, Monterrey, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 30.5 cm. Title from docket.

did.unittitle: Kimble, Helena (Gimlech) Dill.
Petition for confirmation of title to land, Nacogdoches, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 6 p. 30 cm. Accompanied by affirmatory order of the Governor of Coahuila and Texas.

did.unittitle: Arciniega, Miguel.
Testimonial for José Antonio Farias, Bejar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed: Miguel Arciniega, Juan Xavier Busti, and Ygnacio Arocha.

did.unittitle: Testimonials for Ygnacio de Leon and José Gomez, Bejar, Texas.
Poblacion que tiene el Estado de Tamaulipas segun los census particu- lares ultimos de cada pueblo, Victoria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 29.5 cm. Signed: Manuel Garza de Porras.

did.unittitle: Bradburn, Juan Davis.
LS to Manuel de Mier y Teran, Galveston, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 32 cm. Copy, transcription, and translation available. See Series II, Box 4, folder 142.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Jefe Politico.
Copy of letter to Antonio Elozua, Comandante of San Antonio, Bexar, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 32 cm. Concerns the disagreement between J.F. Madero, land commissioner, and J.D. Bradburn, Comandante at Anahuac. Signed: Ramon Musquiz Transcription and translation available. See Series II, Box 4, folder 143.

did.unittitle: Kimble, Helena (Gimlech) Dill.
ADS, Nacogdoches, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 30.5 cm. Signed: Helena Gimlech and witnessed by Manuel de los Santos Coy and two others. Petition is regard to a land title.

did.unittitle: Degollado y Villaseñor, Faustino.
ADS, Matamoros, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 32 cm. Statement of his services in the war for independence, including service under Gen. Mina.

did.unittitle: Bradburn, Juan Davis.
LS to Manuel de Mier y Teran, Galveston

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 31.5 cm. Discusses Austin's opposition to Article 9 of the Law of April 6, 1830.

did.unittitle: [Guerra, Juan].
AL (Copy) to Ministro de Relaciones, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 7 p. 31 cm. Signed: J.G. On irregularities in the recent elections in Victoria, Tamaulipas.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Jefe Politico.
Expediente relativo al numero de familias introducida para el Empresario ... Estevan F. Austin..., Bexar and San Felipe de Austin, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 21 p. 33 cm. Dated 1831 Sep 12 - Oct 27. Signed: Ramon Musquiz, F.W. Johnson, Miguel Arciniega, Walter C. White, Samuel M. Williams.

did.unittitle: Estadistica del Departamento de Texas, San Fernando de Bexar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 5 p. 32 cm. Signed: Ramon Musquiz.

did.unittitle: LS to Governer of Coahuila and Texas, Bejar, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 20 cm. and enclosures 8 p. 25 cm. Signed: Ramon Musquiz Encloses reports of Martin de Leon, Manuel de los Santos Coy, and Frost Thorn on colonization of Guadalupe Victoria and Nacogdoches.

did.unittitle: Austin, John, 1801-1833.
ALS to J.D. Bradburn, Comandante, Anahuac, Brazos Bar, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 20 cm. Sewn together with a copy of letter from S.F. Austin to Bradburn, 1831 Dec 30, Brazoria, and LS from Bradburn to Gen. Teran, 1831 Mar 4, Anahuac. 8 p. 33 cm. On customs administration and politics. Copy, transcription, and translation of LS from Bradburn to Teran available. See Series II, Box 4, folder 144.

did.unittitle: Austin, Stephen Fuller, 1793-1836.
ALS to Comandante General, Estados Internos de Oriente, San Felipe de Austin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 32 cm. Discusses the current situation in Texas.

did.unittitle: Bradburn, Juan Davis.
ALS to Comandante General, Estados Internos de Oriente, Anahuac, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 7 p. 32 cm. On affairs at Anahuac and diffi- culty in collection of customs. Draft of Gen. Teran's reply (3 p.) appended. Copy, transcription, and translation available. See Series II, folder 145.

did.unittitle: Ugartechea, Domingo de, d.1839.
Report of the battle of Velasco to Gen. Mier y Teran, on board the schooner Brazoria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 9 p. 32 cm. Pub. Matamoros 1832 with title: Parte que dio el ciudadano ... Ugartechea ... de la accion que sostuvo en el fuerte de Velasco ... Cf. Streeter, Bib. of Texas , no.785.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Gefe Politico.
Copy of letter to Antonio Elozua, Comandante Militar, Bexar, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 30.5 cm. and enclosure 1 p. 30.5 cm Encloses copy of letter from J.A. Mejia to Elozua.

did.unittitle: Austin, Stephen Fuller, 1793-1836.
Copy of letter to Ramon Musquiz, San Felipe de Austin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 22 p. 30 cm. Accompanied by a document which appears to be an account of the session of the Ayuntamiento of San Felipe de Austin, 1832 Jul 26. Only a few lines of the letter and document are legible. Relative to the Pronunciamento for the Plan of Vera Cruz and to Santa Anna.

did.unittitle: Pronunciamento que hace la seccion que guarnecia el Puerto de Velasco y Villa de Brazoria ...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 32 cm. Signed by Ugartechea and other officers. A copy of the capitulation of Velasco, Jun 29, 1832, is appended.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Jefe Politico.
Censo y estadistica. Departamento de Bejar. Ano de 1832, Bejar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 42 cm. Signed: Ramon Musquiz. Copy made in 1834 by R. Chovel.

did.unittitle: Bradburn, Juan Davis.
Report to Comandante General, Estados Internos de Oriente, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 17 p. 30.5 cm. Report of events in Anahuac. Two versions of transcription and three versions of translation available. See Series II, Box 4, folders 146-149.

did.unittitle: L'Abeille de la Nouvelle Orleans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 32 cm. Translation of an article from No. 474 of L'Abeille , on events in Texas. Accompanied by 12 p. of notes of the events described.

did.unittitle: Extracto de las noticias oficiales recibidas sobre la sublevacion de algunos colonos de Tejas, n.p.
Seguin, Juan Angel.
Certificate of character for Juan MacMullen, Bejar, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 32 cm. Signed: Juan Angel Seguin, Ygnacio Arocha, Victoriano Zepeda.

did.unittitle: Zavala, Lorenzo de, 1788-1836.
ALS to Maríano Cubi y Soler, Toluca, Mexico.
Stone, G.M.
ALS to Col. Chambers, Monclova, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 33 cm. Directions for regaining health.

did.unittitle: San Felipe de Austin, Texas. Ayunta- miento.
LS to Gefe del Departamento de Bejar, San Felipe de Austin, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 21 cm. and enclosures 2 p. 31 cm. Signed: Jno.P.Coles, W. Barret Travis. Transmits results of elections in Brazoria.

did.unittitle: Hernandez, Juan José.
LS to Gaspar Flores, Goliad, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 32 cm. Concerns difficulties in collecting duties from merchants bringing in foreign goods.

did.unittitle: Coahuila and Texas (State) Gobernador, Sep 23, 1833-Jul 23, 1834 (Vidaurri y Villaseñor).
LS to Comandante General los Estados Internos de Oriente, Monclova.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 30 cm. Signed: Francisco Vidaurri y Villaseñor and J. Antonio Padilla. At top of p. 1: Reservado Enclosed: Copy of LS from J.M. Carbajal to Ramon Musquiz, dated 1834 Apr 22, Nacogdoches. 2 p. 30 cm. Concerns the transferring of Indian tribes from the U.S. to Texas by Sam Houston encloses a copy of a letter from J.M. Carbajal relating to this.

did.unittitle: Almonte, Juan Nepomuceno, 1803-1869.
LS to Comandante General, Estados Internos de Oriente, Nacogdoches, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 29.5 cm. Asks Lemus to come to the frontier and plan a campaign against the Comanches.

did.unittitle: LS to Comandante General, Estados Internos de Oriente, Nacogdoches, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 29.5 cm. At top of p. 1: Reservado. Concerns relations with the Indians.

did.unittitle: Arrcola, Vicente.
LS to Comandante General, Estados Internos de Oriente, Monclova, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 30.5 cm and enclosure 1 p. 20.5 cm. Enclosed: Copy of LS to Gobernador de este estado. On two new laws which conflict with his military obligations.

did.unittitle: Almonte, Juan Nepomuceno, 1803-1869.
LS to Comandante General, Estados Internos de Oriente, Nacogdoches, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 29.5 cm. Conditions of the Texas frontier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 30 cm. and enclosures 5 p. 30 cm. On James Power's colonists at Refugio. Encloses copies of his correspondence with Power and Mordecai Cullen.

did.unittitle: LS to Comandante General Estos Estados, Goliad, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 33-58.5 cm. Signed: M. Sabariego. Enclosing reports of the families that arrived at Copano.

LS to Comandante General los Estados Internos, Monclova, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Coahuila and Texas (State) Gobernador, Aug 30 1834-Mar 12 1835 (Elguezabal).
Draft of letter to Gefes del departa- mentos del estado, Monclova, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 30.5 cm. Asks for cooperation of Gefes and Ayuntamientos in restoring order in the state.

did.unittitle: Flores, Gaspar.
Executor's bond, San Antonio de Bexar, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 32 cm. Attested by Ygnacio Chavez and others.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Comandante Militar.
LS to Comandante General estos Estados, Bexar, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 30 cm. and enclosure 2 p. 30 cm. Announces the adhesion of the gar- rison at Bexar to the federalist pronuciamento of Monterrey.

did.unittitle: Estados Internos de Oriente, Mexico. Comandante General, 1834 (Lemus).
AL to Comandante Militar of Goliad, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 21 cm. Signed with rubric. Attributed to Lemus by H.R. Wagner.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Comandante Militar.
LS to Comandante General estos Estados, Bexar, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 30.5 cm. and enclosure 2 p. 30 cm. Signed: Francisco de Castaneda. Encloses a letter from Ramon Musquiz. On affairs in Texas.

LS to Comandante General estos Estados, Goliad, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 30 cm. Signed: M. Sabariego Reports that things are now quiet in Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: [Estados Internos de Oriente, Mexico. Comandante General, 1834-1835 (Cos)].
Drafts of 2 letters to Comandante general, Coahuila and Texas, Boca del rio Bravo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 21 cm. On troop movements in Texas.

LS to Comandante General estos Estados, Goliad, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. with address 25 cm. Signed by John R. Jones and six others.

did.unittitle: Tenorio, Antonio.
Copy of ALS to the Committee of Safety, San Felipe de Austin, San Felipe de Austin, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 27 cm. Asks that the arms he surrendered at Anahuac be returned to him.

did.unittitle: Gritten, Edward.
ALS to Comandante Principal de Coahuila y Texas, San Felipe de Austin, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 24 cm. On affairs in Texas.

LS to Comandante Principal del estado Coahuila y Texas, San Felipe de Austin, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 24 cm. Another copy laid in. On affairs in Texas.

did.unittitle: San Felipe de Austin, Texas. Committee of Safety.
AL to D.C. Barrett and E. Gritten, San Felipe de Austin, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 30.5 cm. Signed by J.H. Bell and seven others. Requests that they explain to Gen. Cos the peaceful intentions of the Texans. Text in Spanish; translated by E. Gritten.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Jefe Politico.
Copy of LS to Alcalde of Gonzales and to Comandante general of Coahuila and Texas, Bejar, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 30 cm. Dated 1835 Sep 20, Sep 27. The letter to Gonzales demands return of a cannon loaned to that settlement; the letter to Gen. Ugartechea reports refusal of the demand.

did.unittitle: Instrucciones a que debe arreglan el Senor Coronel D. Francisco Sandoval, Goliad, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 31 cm. Military instructions.

did.unittitle: San Antonio, Texas. Jefe Politico.
LS to Alcade of San Antonio, Bexar, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. 21 cm. and enclosures 5 p. 31 cm. Signed: Angel Navarro. Requests investigation of a citizen alleged to have a passport from the Texas rebels. The enclosure is Alcade J.M. Flores' interrogation of Zefirin Ruiz, together with the pass, signed by W.D.C. Hall, by order of S.F. Austin.

did.unittitle: Pizarro Martinez, Francisco.
Duplicate of ALS to President Santa Anna, New Orleans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 p. 25 cm. Accompanied by: Plan of Military operation against Texas. Tells of the arrival of Austin, Wharton, and Archer and of the loan they have negotiated and says that he is sending along a plan of military operation against Texas.

did.unittitle: Germain, Z.
ALS to Louis Berlandier, New Orleans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 p. with address 26.5 cm. Attached: Copy of the capitulation between General Cos and Edward Burleson, Dec 10, 1835 (4 p. 26.5 cm.).

did.unittitle: Coahuila, Mexico. Gobernador, Jan 1842-Mar 1843 (Mejia).
3 LS to José Ignacio Gutierrez, Saltillo, Mexico.
Burnet, David Gouverneur, 1788-1870.
ALS to Mary Austin Holley, Oakland, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 p. 28 cm. Information on Sam Houston, the battle of San Jacinto, and S.F. Austin for Mrs. Holley's history of Texas.

did.unittitle: Mejicanos! [Copy of pronunciamento by the garrison of Mazatlan]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 12 p. 32 cm. Warns of approaching invasion by the U.S.

did.unittitle: Severance, Luther, 1797-1855.
Translation of a letter to the National Intelligencer, [Washington, D.C.?]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 8 p. 27 cm. At end: Traducido para el Liberal Moderado del Tribuno, Periodico de Nueva York - semi-semanario de 30 de Mayo proximo parado. Tells why he did not vote in favor of the resolution which called for money for the war with Mexico.

did.unittitle: Asuntos de la guerra con E.U.A.
Letter to unknown recipient, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed with a cross. Title from docket.

did.unittitle: La República de México, llamada N. España...
Document addressed to American occupying forces in Mexico, containing ideas for the reorganization Mexico's civil institutions, Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 12 p. Attached letter and translation in response to document. Enclosed are notes on document by César Rodríguez, Curator of the Latin American Collection of Yale University Library, prepared in 1994.

did.unittitle: 1847. Movimientos de los Americanos, n.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 p. 28 cm. Title from docket. Notes on movements of American troops in Mexico.

did.unittitle: Mier y Teran, Manuel de, 1789-1832.
Voyage aux populations des rives du Rio Bravo del Norte par le General M.M. Teran. Ecrit par lui-meme, [n.p.]

scopecontent.p: 10 p. 32 cm. Unsigned and undated draft. Text in Spanish.
